transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, vikas. welcome to the interview for the python developer role. how are you today?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. im doing well, thank you. i appreciate the opportunity.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: before we begin, id like to give you a quick overview of todays interview. well discuss your python experience, object-oriented programming concepts, and your general coding approach. lets start with your background. can you tell me about your experience working with python?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: sure. i have around three years of experience using python for scripting and small application development. i have mainly worked on automation scripts and backend utilities.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats good. lets move into object-oriented programming. can you explain what oop is?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: oop stands for object oriented programming. it includes concepts like classes, objects, inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain inheritance with a practical example?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: inheritance means one class can take properties from another class. i understand the definition, but i find it a bit difficult to explain real-life examples clearly.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats okay. can you explain polymorphism?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: polymorphism means the same function name can behave differently.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: how comfortable are you with designing classes for real-world problems?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i usually follow existing patterns, but im not very confident in designing complex class structures from scratch.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: lets talk about exception handling. how do you handle errors in python?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: we use try and except blocks to catch exceptions.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you give an example of a custom exception you have created?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i havent created custom exceptions yet. i mostly use built-in ones.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. do you have experience writing unit tests for your python code?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have limited experience with unit testing.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you for your responses. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions right now. thank you for your time.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, vikas. it was nice speaking with you. well get back to you with the next steps.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: thank you. have a good day.
